page.title: 16CONINGTON - EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The only jobs in Conington are agricultural and as there are only three farms the majority of people commute to local towns such as Huntingdon and Cambridge. The farms are basically arable but one farmer, Lilly, has a herd of Blanche d'Aquitaine cattle and keeps sheep. Another, Papworth, has a dozen long horned cattle and also keeps chickens and geese. Farmer Wright's farm is purely arable with just one horse. Some of the occupations of the commutors are: computer salesman, book shop owner, university lecturer, college staff, head of a major department store in Cambridge, doctor, pilot, navigator.
